@KarenLondoner Haha!.. Actually, the few times when City got undone, was by a team pressing very tightly and relentlessly. That's probably the way to get at us, rather than the megabus parking, most timidly by Chelsea this season..

@MrRajPop I think they've done so well - and the numbers don't even begin to describe the sumtuous style of football they've played either. Now looking forward to seeing Kane, Alli, Trippier, Dier, Walker, Stones and Sterling (and Delph!) in the World Cup!..
@KarenLondoner Hope you feel more Tuesday-ish soon! (And even perhaps Friday-ish..!)
@KarenLondoner Or whether they might go got Arteta or Vieira from City?..
@KarenLondoner Will let you know when we do any more in the future, Karen! How's things with you?.. And who would you like next after Arsene?..

@kirankishore21 That's a tough one! With variety & value in mind, my 5 would be: -breakfast @KoyaLondon, @Honeyandco -lunch @Indian_Accent, @ChezBruce -dinner @QualityChop (... but could easily add loads more to that list!!)

@CloHutch_ @MarketHalls @HotBoxLDN What's funny is that it could get easily missed in favour of some more 'standout' dishes from this and other stalls - but I thought this poutine was just perfect. Melting brisket. Deep smokey sauce. Spicy sriracha. All messy and dirty. What's not to love! ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡¦
@MarketHalls @HotBoxLDN I did...and so has my cholesterol! (but totally worth it!)

So this was my guilty pleasure today (oh, notwithstanding this was already my 4th dish @markethalls!) - Beef brisket poutine with smokey sriracha + bbq sauce from @hotboxldn. Maybe it's my Canadian roots, but this side totally rocked..ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡¦ðŸŽ¸ðŸŽ¶ #poutine #lovelondon https://t.co/dn7lyqB8S4

Really excited to put on our second seasonal #supperclub (with @JohnnieFKP) on Sat night 19th May in London - ONE SPACE LEFT, so do get in touch if you're interested. Spring's the theme! And here's a taster of what happened last time.. #lovelondon https://t.co/yZRQuQImvF
@meemalee Well my favourite for old skool British food is @TheGameBirdLON, and favourite for atmosphere is @RulesRestaurant..

What to do with a disused tube station ticket office? Turn it into a food hall + pack it with fantastic food stalls! Hats off to the new @markethalls and its resident food joints, inc @CalcuttaCanteen @farangLDN @HotBoxLDN @Butchies_London. Definitely worth a return ticket..ðŸš‚ðŸšƒ https://t.co/IQdjWXhxgE

@jennylinford @Indian_Accent I'm with you on that one. Fell in love with this dessert..

@le_petit_oeuf Well first immigration authorities changed it to Volinksy, as they couldn't pronounce the 'ch' and they plonked a '-sky' at the end of many immigrants from East Europe at the time. Then generation later, family changed it to 'Vallance' as it was quite common name in Glasgow..
@le_petit_oeuf Interesting story Gavin! My family name also changed from Chvollin to Vallance, back in the day. Think I'll stick with Vallance though!
RT @le_petit_oeuf: I just published â€œExperience is not a Storyâ€ https://t.co/YCCFoBlPt8

Love food? Love wine? Then wine not come along to my + @JohnnieFKP 'wine-matching supper-club'. 4 courses x 4 wine. Produce from @Londonfarmers. Spring is the theme! In Southfields, night of Sat 19th May. One place left, so do get in touch if interested.. #spring #supperclub https://t.co/oSE0sM1GJ0
